title: Drawing, "Design for a Decorative Ewer", 1765
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: In pen and brown ink, lower left: J. C. Delafosse
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Handle of ewer consists of a swan rising from the lap of mermaid. Two putti support a shell which serves as spout. A girl, a child, and rope-like festoons decorate the upper register of the ewer. Fluted lower portion on an acanthus leaf base; verso: design for coffee pot.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Decorative Ewer", 1765.
1765. Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-384.
